section.para: Marks up a substring inside a headword or inside a headword translation which is not part of the expression itself but stands for things that can take its place. An application can use the inline markup to format the placeholders differently from the rest of the text, to ignore the placeholder in full-text search, and so on. Examples: , .

listitem.para: startIndex (required). Non-negative integer. The index of the first character of the substring according to the number of Unicode code points. The first character of the string has index 0. This property may be implicit if using in-line markup.
endIndex (required). Non-negative integer. The index of the last character after the substring according to the number of Unicode code points. This property may be implicit if using in-line markup
